|Description=In particular, to know the indications for emergency MRI (neurovascular pathway)
|Section=Additional examinations
|Contributors=Nicolas Weiss
|Order=10}}

- Brain MRI more sensitive than CT scan

- Preferred as 1st intention if available in case of :

o suspected ischaemic stroke (basilar trunk thrombosis, malignant sylvian stroke)

o suspected encephalitis

- don't hesitate to call a vascular neurology service for help

question.question: In which of the following scenarios is an emergency MRI preferred as the first diagnostic tool, if available?
question.option_a: Suspected traumatic brain injury with visible skull fracture
question.option_b: Suspected ischaemic stroke involving the basilar trunk or malignant sylvian stroke
question.option_c: Suspected concussion with no loss of consciousness
question.option_d: Suspected mild encephalitis with no neurological deficits
